abstract: Former News International lawyer Julian Pike tells British lawmakers that company knew as early as 2008 that phone hacking was widespread at now defunct newspaper The News of the World.
snippet: Julian Pike, a lawyer who acted for the tabloid The News of the World, said he knew the company’s claim that the practice was limited to one “rogue reporter” was untrue.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods

lead_paragraph: Julian Pike, a lawyer who acted for the tabloid The News of the World, said he knew the company’s claim that the practice was limited to one “rogue reporter” was untrue.

headline.main: News International Knew of Broader Hacking in 2008, Lawmakers Are Told
headline.print_headline: Britain: Company Knew of More Hacking, Lawyer Says
